text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kato was born in Nagoya on December 22, 1958. After graduating from Hosei University, he joined Japan Soccer League Division 2 club Toshiba in 1981. The club won 1981 JSL Cup. However he left the club for injury in 1983. In 1985, he joined Division 1 club All Nippon Airways. However the club was relegated to Division 2 end of 1985/86 season. He retired end of 1987/88 season. On August 30, 1981, Kato debuted for the Japan national team against Malaysia. On September 3, he scored a goal against India. He played 3 games and scored 1 goal for Japan in 1981. ==Statistics== |- |1981||rowspan="3"|Toshiba||rowspan="3"|JSL Division 2|||| |- |1982|||| |- |1983||7||3 |- |1985–86||rowspan="3"|All Nippon Airways||JSL Division 1||8||1 |- |1986–87||rowspan="2"|JSL Division 2||0||0 |- |1987–88||2||0 17+||4+ 17+||4+ |} Japan National Football Team Database |- |1981||3||1 |- !Total||3||1 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Aichi Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Hokkaido Consadole Sapporo players Category:Yokohama Flügels players
